Tropical Medicine	45	23	36	No		"The training program in Clinical Tropical Medicine and Traveler?s Health (?Diploma Course?) is designed to provide a comprehensive educational experience for physicians and other health professionals seeking certification in Tropical Medicine and Traveler?s Health through the American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene (ASTM&H). The purpose of this program is to provide a structured curriculum with practical instruction in tropical medicine, including the pathophysiology, clinical features, diagnosis, treatment, and control of diseases prevalent in the tropics. All of the courses required for this program are also required for students in the master of public health and tropical medicine (MPH&TM) program." International Health & Development	25	0	0	yes		"The purpose of the DrPH program is to produce graduates who can identify economic, demographic, epidemiological, and cultural data needed to identify and analyze health-related problems for the design of effective projects/programs; elaborate and execute applied research studies to gather necessary information; analyze applied research studies, synthesize results and identify promising policies and programs; and utilize state-of-the-art communications technologies, to present concise executive presentations of synthesized applied research conclusions. For more information please see: http://www.sph.tulane.edu/IHD/programs-degrees/doctoral.htm#matrix"	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Doctoral	6	DrPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/IHD/index.htm			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Epidemiology	11	23	15	yes		"The Dr.P.H. is the terminal degree in epidemiology oriented towards applied research in various areas of public health rather than in basic research. This degree provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to conduct epidemiologic investigations for the solution of public health problems, and the ability to apply the results, in public health practice. The program prepares graduates to work as epidemiologists in a public health setting.

Public health agencies and organizations, including universities, have a need for leaders with an in-depth understanding of the conditions and determinants of health and disease in the population.  These leaders may develop new programs, may conduct in-depth independent evaluations of programs or may conduct applied research that is relevant to program implementation.  They may also teach public health to current and future public health professionals.  The range of employment opportunities for graduates includes faculty positions, evaluation positions and health director positions."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Doctoral	6	DrPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/epidemiology/index.html			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Community Health Sciences	33	28	18	yes		"""Our DrPH program trains students for advanced science-based practice and practice-oriented research. Students are matched to faculty advisors with similar research interests. The course of study is individualized to the student's interests. To be eligible for the DrPH program you must have a master's degree or 30 graduate-level credits in public health or a closely-related field.

Students must complete certain core requirements and a total of 60 credit hours in public health. Students usually take courses in statistics, research methods, and advanced courses in their content area. The post-master's coursework usually takes 12-24 months to complete. At the end of the course work you must pass a comprehensive examination, conduct research, and complete a dissertation. Students work closely with doctoral advisors and doctoral committee members on their dissertation research.
"""	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Doctoral	6	DrPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Environmental Health Sciences	10	34	39	yes		The DrPH degree program is designed to provide students with terminal knowledge and skills in practice-based research. Graduates are typically candidates for leadership positions in public health practice. The Department of Environmental Health Sciences offers two tracks for the DrPH: Envrionmental Policy and Global Environmental Health Sciences. Information about the Environmental Policy track may be found here: http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/programs/drph/drph-env-pol.htm and information about the Global Environmental Health Sciences track may be found here: http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/programs/drph/drph-glob-env.htm. Epidemiology	25	0	0	Yes		"The Doctor of Public Health (DrPH) program in International Health and Global Studies (IHGS) is based on the development of skills and knowledge essential for advanced positions in public health or applied academic research. The principal objective of the Program is to train students to be independent researchers in the field of international health, with particular emphasis on conducting population-based studies. The program provides the opportunity for students to acquire skills important to careers in needs assessment and disease intervention with non-governmental organizations, official health agencies and both bilateral and multilateral aid organizations working in developing nations."	University of Alabama-Birmingham School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Doctoral	6	DrPH	http://www.soph.uab.edu/soph_catalog/catalog_alt.asp?action=show&id=243&cid=50&sid=140		International Health	http://www.sophas.org/schools/UAB.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Alabama.pdf		
Health Care Organization & Policy	27	39	21	Yes		The DrPH degree is the highest professional degree in public health. The DrPH Program in Public Health Management will prepare current and future public health leaders to apply critical thinking and rigorous research methods to the complex practical problems facing practitioners and policy-makers in public health practice. The Department of Environmental Health Sciences offers the DrPH in three areas of emphasis: environmental health (EH), environmental management and policy (EMP) and occupational health and safety (OHS)." Health Systems Management	16	17	27	yes		"The MHA curriculum is developed on the premise that effectiveness in health systems management requires understanding of health and health systems in addition to business skills. In core courses, students are instructed in the fundamentals of business and functional areas of management within the context of health services. Students are introduced to the key public health disciplines and examine legal and ethical concerns of the industry. Core courses also examine the dynamics of the workforce, logistics of health service delivery, and the distinctive economic and strategic concerns of health care. Elective studies offer students advanced and specialized courses within a broad range of management topics. The MHA program is complemented by an Administrative Residency experience within the 2 year program. This experience provides students with unique research, learning and community service opportunities that will have a lasting and profound impact on them, New Orleans, the region, and communities around the world."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	11	MHA	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/hsm/index.htm			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Health Systems Management	16	17	0	yes		"Tulane was the first university to establish a joint degree program in business and health systems management leading to award of the joint MBA/MHA degree upon completion of 93 academic credits. The joint degree is offered between the A.B. Freeman School of Business and the School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine.  The joint curriculum is divided equally between the two schools with the majority of the first year spent in the business school. HSM course work is concentrated in the second and third years.
The joint program incorporates MBA and HSM management core courses, including health law, quantitative decision making, health care organization, and health care financial management. Two Administrative Internship courses and a full-time summer Administrative Residency provide the curriculum's required field experiences."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	12	MBA/MHA	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/hsm/index.htm	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Health Systems Management	16	17	19	yes		"For students enrolled in the Tulane School of Law who seek health law careers, the MHA
provides valuable health systems and health management knowledge for the individual who plans to specialize in healthcare law. Members of law firms specializing in health, in-house legal counsel, and many other attorneys who deal with the complex regulatory environment of health care providers recognize that knowledge of health care management is integral to their legal experience. The joint JD/MHA program offers this combined educational foundation." Biostatistics (BIOS)	3	0	0	Yes		"Biostatistics is the science that applies statistical theory and methods to the solution of problems in the biological sciences. The biostatistician differs from the traditional statistician in that he or she is confronted by a wider range of problems dealing with all the phenomena that affect people?s physical, social, and mental well-being.

Public Health Informatics is the science underlying the integration of computer science, information science, and public health science applied to the acquisition, management, processing, analysis, and synthesis of public health data, information, and knowledge supporting public health research, education, and practice.

Bioinformatics is defined as the field of science in which biology, computer science, biostatistics and information technology merge to form a single discipline.  Bioinformatics more properly refers to the creation and advancement of algorithms, computational and statistical techniques, and theory to solve formal and practical problems arising from the management and analysis of biological data."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/bios/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Health (GH)	25	7	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/gh/index.php		Community Health & Development	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/hpm/index.php		Health Services Management	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Behavioral Sciences & Health Education (BSHE)	18	20	0	Yes		"The Department of Behavioral Sciences and Health Education (BSHE) is committed to improving health behaviors through education, knowledge production, and cutting-edge research in a wide array of public health areas.  BSHE faculty and students employ a variety of disciplinary approaches to implement and evaluate behavioral interventions that address a wide range of public health problems including sexually transmitted diseases, cancer, mental health, smoking, substance abuse, and violence.  BSHE improves health communication by translating research into practice.

BSHE is committed to an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving in domestic and global arenas.  Its faculty has a strong track record of obtaining substantial funding from public and private sources, providing student opportunities in research, and employment with a wide variety of agencies and organizations engaged in public health practice and policy.  Our mission is to prepare students to confront today's public health concerns and to respond to tomorrow's public health challenges." Epidemiology (EPI)	11	23	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background." Global Health (GH)	25	23	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/gh/index.php		Infectious Disease	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Environmental Health (GEH)	10	25	0	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/eoh/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Healthcare Outcomes Management 	27	16	8	Yes		"The health care outcomes management option is especially relevant as the evolution of both public health and medical care services continue at a rapid pace. The advances in drug therapy, an increased emphasis on wellness behavior, the promise of gene therapy, the advent of evidence-based medicine and continued demands for accountability by health care consumers has precipitated new demand for professional skills in a wide range of existing positions as well as created new employment opportunities.

The outcomes option provides the CMPH participant with the opportunity to learn state of the art techniques for evaluating health care outcomes. The learning is predicated on understanding the creation of value, i.e., the understanding of the relationships between cost and quality. The option focuses on measurement tools, evidence-based medicine and cost analysis. It concludes with the development of an outcome analysis project for the participant's organization."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH-(Career MPH Distance Based)	http://www.sph.emory.edu/CMPH/			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Prevention Science 	40	18	8	Yes		"The Prevention Science option emphasizes the development and assessment of population-based interventions. Preventive science is concerned with the study of effective preventive interventions within systems. The target audience of this study may be individuals and/or broader levels of the social environment, such as families, work or school settings, communities, and policies.

The Prevention Science courses offer the foundations of behavioral theories, program planning, research design, evaluation, and health communication through traditional and emerging technologies. Students will acquire the skills necessary to plan, implement, and evaluate community programs, and to communicate health and behavioral information. The Prevention Science curriculum prepares students in the essential public health services and competencies. The courses place a strong emphasis on application of prevention science knowledge, behavioral theories and models to real-life public health situation and settings."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH-(Career MPH Distance Based)	http://www.sph.emory.edu/CMPH/			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Applied Epidemiology 	11	8	47	Yes		"The Applied Epidemiology option is geared to meeting the needs of the student who anticipates working as an epidemiologist in a practice-based setting. While the practice setting envisioned in developing this curriculum is a national, state/regional, or local government public health agency, practice settings may include health care institutions, pharmaceutical or other health care industry companies, international agencies, or foundations where epidemiologists are employed.

Applied Epidemiology courses will integrate content from the Rollins School of Public Health traditional MPH degree program in epidemiology into the CMPH distance-based learning format. In addition to dressing the core competencies that are part of CMPH training at the Rollins School of Public Health, the curriculum will also address the Applied Epidemiology competencies developed by the Council of State and Territorial Epidemiologists. Within this area of concentration, students may elect to focus on infectious diseases, maternal and child health, or chronic disease epidemiology." Environmental and Occupational Health	10	34	44	Yes			Texas A&M University School of Rural Public Health	Spring 2010	Masters	20	MPH	http://srph.tamhsc.edu/environmental-health/index.html			http://www.sophas.org/schools/TexasA&M.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/texasA&M.pdf		
Environmental Health	10	0	0	yes		"The environmental policy concentration area is designed to promote critical and advanced understanding of the functions and outcomes of environmental policy and their relationship to public health. In this regard, there is focus on the theory and practice of environmental policy with core inquiries directed at: policy development, adaptation and change; and the interplay among science, policy, and practice.  with an emphasis on how policy creates and drives advances in environmental health sciences, and how these sciences inform policy.

At the completion of the MPH in Environmental Policy, the student will be able to:
? Apply international, federal and state regulatory programs, guidelines and authorities to address public health issues
? Conduct analyses of existing policies and regulations integrating public health science, policy, and practice. 
? Evaluate the direct and indirect human, ecological and safety effects of major environmental resource agents on human health.
? Examine the role of policy in public health decision-making 
? Develop a policy framework to address a contemporary environmental health issue."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

International Health & Development	25	0	0	yes		"The purpose of the MPH is to train public health professionals for a career in an international setting. Graduates of IHD typically pursue careers in international organizations as mid-level technicians or senior managers of social sector programs in the developing world. Graduates of the Department of International Health and Development work around the world in a wide range of agencies including: the World Bank, UNICEF, World Health Organization (WHO), UNAIDs, Family Health International (FHI), the Population Council, IPAS, Helen Keller International, Save the Children-UK, and CARE.

IHD offers concentrations in several content areas (www.sph.tulane.edu/IHD/programs-degrees/subjectandskills.shtml). The knowledge and technical skills taught in the program are applicable to domestic public health settings as well, such as urban health initiatives, state and local HIV/AIDS, public nutrition and family planning programs."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/IHD/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Maternal & Child Health	28	7	0	yes		"The track of Maternal and Child Health has a particular focus on the social and environmental determinants of the health of women and children. The MCH track is also closely aligned with the Tulane/Xavier National Center of Excellence in Women's Health.
In the MPH program we offer a general major in maternal and child health and tracks that focus more specifically on women?s health or child health. In addition, we offer dual majors in maternal and child health/health education, maternal and child health epidemiology, and global maternal and child health. Our courses give students a background in the biologic and social issues important to the health of women and children, as well as concepts and skills needed to address the broad range of public health problems affecting their health."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Occupational and Environmental Health	34	10	0	yes		"The Occupational and Environmental Health distance learning program is designed for physicians, nurses and other health professionals who work in occupational health programs or clinics.

The curriculum is designed to provide the didactic elements for an MPH in Occupational Medicine and to meet the requirements of the academic year for board certification in preventive medicine/occupational medicine. The 42-hour curriculum includes study in biostatistics, epidemiology, health services management and administration, environmental health, toxicology, occupational medicine, behavioral aspects of the workplace, and health risk reduction."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Distance Learning	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Occupational Health & Safety Management	34	10	0	yes		"The Occupational Health and Safety Management Master of Public Health program is designed for mid-career professionals who already have a strong technical background in occupational health and safety or industrial hygiene who seek to augment their management abilities and increase their career options.

After successfully completing the program, students should be able to apply budgeting and finance principles to environmental and health and safety programs, and be able to integrate these programs into standard management systems. Students from this program improve their abilities to manage people, projects and processes. The OHSM program is offered only in the distance learning format."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Distance Learning	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Maternal and Child Health/ Epidemiology	28	11	0	yes		"The traditional field of Maternal and Child Health is changing rapidly, with a growing use of data to better understand and solve the health problems of women and children. Students in the Maternal and Child Health Epidemiology dual-major track learn about the biologic and social factors important to health and develop the data analysis skills to delve into them further and to evaluate the effectiveness of public health programs. The curriculum combines courses from the departments of community health sciences and epidemiology and can be completed in 45 credit hours. "	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Maternal and Child Health/ Epidemiology	28	11	0	yes		"The traditional field of Maternal and Child Health is changing rapidly, with a growing use of data to better understand and solve the health problems of women and children. Students in the Maternal and Child Health Epidemiology dual-major track learn about the biologic and social factors important to health and develop the data analysis skills to delve into them further and to evaluate the effectiveness of public health programs. The curriculum combines courses from the departments of community health sciences and epidemiology and can be completed in 45 credit hours. "	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Spring 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/epidemiology/index.html			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Maternal and Child Health/Epidemiology	28	11	0	yes		This dual major is for students who want to combine an in-depth understanding of the health problems of women and children with the tools of health education. If you follow this rigorous dual-major track you will complete the course requirements of both the Maternal and Child Health track and the Health Education track in 45 credit hours. 	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Summer 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Nutrition	33	13	0	yes		"The Nutrition track provides students with the skills to improve the nutritional health of individuals, households, and communities by addressing the social and environmental causes of nutrition problems. Besides faculty members in the Department of Community Health Sciences, students work with faculty members in other departments who have interests and expertise in nutrition. We have close ties to many agencies in New Orleans working to promote nutrition, providing plenty of opportunities for practical field work."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Health Education/Communication	18	20	0	yes		"The track of Health Education and Communication focuses on providing students with skills to promote health at the population level. Our strength is in working with communities to assist them in promoting health of their own members. Faculty members have expertise in planning of health education programs, evaluation of health education programs, working with communities to bring about change, and social marketing. Through the course work students learn concepts of community and how to work with community groups, approaches to planning prevention programs, and rigorous methods of evaluating programs. We work closely with many local governmental and nonprofit organizations, so there are many opportunities to hone the skills you learn in the classroom through real-world experiences."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Global Maternal and Child Health	28	25	0	yes		Many students want to work in developing countries for some years of their public health careers but also want skills that are applicable to the U.S. The Global Maternal and Child Health track is a dual major program that combines coursework from the departments of International Health and Community Health Sciences to give students the background and skills they need to work in promotion of reproductive health in poor or wealthy nations. The curriculum is completed in 45 credit hours.	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Disaster Management/Environmental Health	10	39	0	yes		"""At the completion of the MPH in Disaster Management, the student will be able to:
? Apply public health science, policy, and practice principles to address the health threats resulting from natural and intentional  disasters
? Integrate environmental public health strategies in the development, execution, and evaluation of each core component of disaster management: preparedness, detection, response, containment, and recovery
? Implement population-based interventions to protect communities, particularly vulnerable populations, from natural and intentional disasters 
? Evaluate the capacity of public health systems to effectively and efficaciously respond to natural and intentional disasters
"""	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Distance Learning 	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Disaster Management/Environmental Health	10	39	0	yes		"At the completion of the MPH in Disaster Management, the student will be able to:
? Apply public health science, policy, and practice principles to address the health threats resulting from natural and intentional  disasters
? Integrate environmental public health strategies in the development, execution, and evaluation of each core component of disaster management: preparedness, detection, response, containment, and recovery
? Implement population-based interventions to protect communities, particularly vulnerable populations, from natural and intentional disasters 
? Evaluate the capacity of public health systems to effectively and efficaciously respond to natural and intentional disasters
"	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Summer 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Distance Learning 	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Epidemiology	11	23	15	yes		"The MPH program provides rigorous education in basic epidemiologic and biostatistical methods in several content areas including cardiovascular disease, infectious disease, genetic epidemiology, molecular and cancer epidemiology, reproductive epidemiology and environmental disease.  Students gain a thorough knowledge of the sources of health data and their use in epidemiologic studies and are able to design and implement studies for collection of data from original sources, such as field surveys. Students will also acquire skills in the processing, analysis and reporting of data. The program prepares graduates for positions in public and private agencies in which epidemiologic information is needed for health policy decisions, as well as for the management of research projects in academic and other institutions."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/epidemiology/index.html		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Global Health Systems Management	17	16	25	yes		The MPH in Global Health Systems Management prepares students to assume management and leadership roles in the global health arena.  The courses are designed to convey practical skills and knowledge relevant for successful global health managers and decision-makers.  The program will also allow students the opportunity to take courses offered in partner universities around the world.	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/hsm/index.htm			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

The courses are designed to convey practical skills and knowledge relevant for successful global health managers and decision-makers.  The program will also allow students the opportunity to take courses offered in partner universities around the world. Health Systems Management	17	16	27	yes		The MPH focuses on the application of management concepts and competencies in public health to improve the health of the community. The  curriculum is designed for students and public health professionals interested in domestic or international public health courses with an emphasis on skills and methods used in management and leadership roles especially at the operating level. Biostatistics	3	0	0	Yes		"The MPH degree in biostatistics is intended primarily for those persons who wish to acquire an MPH degree with an emphasis in statistical methodology. This can include individuals from decision-making positions in health care settings as well as those interested in data management, statistical analyses and interpretation, and presentation of analytical results. Note that the MPH does not require some of the theoretical courses required for the MS, and as such, it is not a direct route to prepare a student for a PhD. Students anticipating that they will wish to continue for a PhD are advised to pursue the MS rather than the MPH."	University of Alabama-Birmingham School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.soph.uab.edu/soph_catalog/catalog_alt.asp?action=show&id=226&cid=48&sid=138		Biostatistics	http://www.sophas.org/schools/UAB.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Alabama.pdf		
Environmental Health Sciences	34	0	0	Yes		"This track is designed specifically for and limited to graduates of undergraduate Industrial Hygiene programs financially supported by the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH). Graduates of these programs have received basic courses from NIOSH, peer-reviewed and approved Industrial Hygiene curricula, and are qualified to practice Industrial Hygiene. The Accelerated Program in Industrial Hygiene will broaden the student's public health knowledge and skills while also preparing students to take leadership roles in Industrial Hygiene."	University of Alabama-Birmingham School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	20	MPH	http://www.soph.uab.edu/soph_catalog/catalog_alt.asp?action=show&id=232&cid=49&sid=139		Accelerated Industrial Hygiene	http://www.sophas.org/schools/UAB.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Alabama.pdf		
Environmental Health Sciences	34	0	0	Yes		"The MPH in industrial hygiene combines didactic research instruction and applied research experience for students with or without previous work experience. The industrial hygiene program is designed to develop the students' understanding of the interrelationships between the basic sciences and the causes and prevention of occupational related diseases. Graduates of the program will be capable of developing systematic approaches to identifying and controlling problems in industrial hygiene, designing and implementing research programs to measure the level of work exposure to hazardous agents, and instituting necessary control measures." Environmental Health Sciences	10	44	0	Yes		It is important for prospective students to understand that the MPH in Environmental Health/Toxicology and the MPH in Occupational Health and Safety are considered professional degree programs. These degree tracks are considered to be a continuation of one's professional experience and are intended to augment the information that one has already learned through that experience. Epidemiology (EPI)	11	0	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	24	MPH/DPT	http://www.sph.emory.edu/epi/index.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Health (GH)	25	0	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	24	MPH/DPT	http://www.sph.emory.edu/gh/index.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	24	MPH/DPT	http://www.sph.emory.edu/hpm/index.php	Yes	Health Policy	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG." Behavioral Sciences & Health Education (BSHE)	18	20	0	Yes		"The Department of Behavioral Sciences and Health Education (BSHE) is committed to improving health behaviors through education, knowledge production, and cutting-edge research in a wide array of public health areas.  BSHE faculty and students employ a variety of disciplinary approaches to implement and evaluate behavioral interventions that address a wide range of public health problems including sexually transmitted diseases, cancer, mental health, smoking, substance abuse, and violence.  BSHE improves health communication by translating research into practice.

BSHE is committed to an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving in domestic and global arenas.  Its faculty has a strong track record of obtaining substantial funding from public and private sources, providing student opportunities in research, and employment with a wide variety of agencies and organizations engaged in public health practice and policy.  Our mission is to prepare students to confront today's public health concerns and to respond to tomorrow's public health challenges." Global Health (GH)	25	19	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	26	MPH/JD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_jdmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	19	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	26	MPH/JD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_jdmph.php	Yes	Health Policy	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Behavioral Sciences & Health Education (BSHE)	18	20	19	Yes		"The Department of Behavioral Sciences and Health Education (BSHE) is committed to improving health behaviors through education, knowledge production, and cutting-edge research in a wide array of public health areas.  BSHE faculty and students employ a variety of disciplinary approaches to implement and evaluate behavioral interventions that address a wide range of public health problems including sexually transmitted diseases, cancer, mental health, smoking, substance abuse, and violence.  BSHE improves health communication by translating research into practice.

BSHE is committed to an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving in domestic and global arenas.  Its faculty has a strong track record of obtaining substantial funding from public and private sources, providing student opportunities in research, and employment with a wide variety of agencies and organizations engaged in public health practice and policy.  Our mission is to prepare students to confront today's public health concerns and to respond to tomorrow's public health challenges."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	26	MPH/JD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_jdmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Epidemiology (EPI)	11	23	19	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	26	MPH/JD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_jdmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Environmental Health (GEH)	10	25	19	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	26	MPH/JD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_jdmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Maternal & Child Health	28	19	0	yes		"The JD/MPH joint-degree program is for students who have an interest in applying law and policy to public health problems. The entire course of study usually lasts four years. You can concentrate in any of the different focus areas within our department (maternal and child health, health education, or nutrition). You can begin this program either at the public health school or the law school, but when you begin in the law school you must take courses solely there for one academic year. If you are interested in this program you should apply to both schools, indicating on both applications that you are interested in the joint degree." Health Policy & Management	16	17	27	Yes			Boston University School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	30	MPH/MBA	http://sph.bu.edu/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=467&Itemid=50569	yes	Health Care Management	http://www.sophas.org/schools/BostonUniversity.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/SOPHAS_Intl.pdf		
International Health	25	17	27	Yes			Boston University School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	30	MPH/MBA	http://sph.bu.edu/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=679&Itemid=616937	yes	Global Health Management	http://www.sophas.org/schools/BostonUniversity.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/SOPHAS_Intl.pdf		
Epidemiology (EPI)	11	16	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	30	MPH/MBA	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mbamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Health (GH)	25	16	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	30	MPH/MBA	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mbamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	30	MPH/MBA	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mbamph.php	Yes	Health Policy	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Environmental Health (GEH)	10	25	16	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	30	MPH/MBA	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mbamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Environmental & Occupational Health (EOH)	10	34	16	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009." Global Health (GH)	25	0	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	32	MPH/MD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mdmph/dualdegree_mdmph_nonemory.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	32	MPH/MD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mdmph/dualdegree_mdmph_nonemory.php	Yes	Health Policy	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Behavioral Sciences & Health Education (BSHE)	18	20	0	Yes		"The Department of Behavioral Sciences and Health Education (BSHE) is committed to improving health behaviors through education, knowledge production, and cutting-edge research in a wide array of public health areas.  BSHE faculty and students employ a variety of disciplinary approaches to implement and evaluate behavioral interventions that address a wide range of public health problems including sexually transmitted diseases, cancer, mental health, smoking, substance abuse, and violence.  BSHE improves health communication by translating research into practice.

BSHE is committed to an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving in domestic and global arenas.  Its faculty has a strong track record of obtaining substantial funding from public and private sources, providing student opportunities in research, and employment with a wide variety of agencies and organizations engaged in public health practice and policy.  Our mission is to prepare students to confront today's public health concerns and to respond to tomorrow's public health challenges."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	32	MPH/MD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mdmph/dualdegree_mdmph_nonemory.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Epidemiology (EPI)	11	23	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	32	MPH/MD	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_mdmph/dualdegree_mdmph_nonemory.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Environmental Health (GEH)	10	25	0	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009." International Health & Development	25	0	0	no		"Tulane's MD/MPH program offers options for students who have already been admitted to Tulane University School of Medicine and who wish to complete the requirements for both the medical degree and public health degree. Requirements for the MD/MPH combined degree should be completed within 4 years.  Students may begin the combined degree program as early as the summer before their School of Medicine curriculum begins. 

The Department of International Health and Development is dedicated to improving the health status of populations throughout the world. The MD/MPH program in this department addresses the needs of medical students who intend to work outside the U.S. in international organizations, or in multicultural contexts, through development of methodological skills for program and policy formulation, implementation and evaluation. The curriculum and applied learning opportunities draw on the department?s extensive overseas research and programs in developing countries, support to major international organizations and more than twenty years of experience providing training to students from around the world."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	32	MD/MPH     	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/IHD/index.htm	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Requirements for the MD/MPH combined degree should be completed within 4 years.  Students may begin the combined degree program as early as the summer before their School of Medicine curriculum begins. 

The MD/MPH program focusing in Community Health Sciences prepares health professionals for leadership in community health practice through education, research, and practice directed at community-based health promotion and disease prevention." Environmental Health                                         	10	44	39	no		"Tulane's MD/MPH program offers options for students who have already been admitted to Tulane University School of Medicine and who wish to complete the requirements for both the medical degree and public health degree. Requirements for the MD/MPH combined degree should be completed within 4 years.  Students may begin the combined degree program as early as the summer before their School of Medicine curriculum begins. 

The MD/MPH program focusing in Environmental Health Sciences strives to equip students with the knowledge and skills to accomplish the following: 1) Apply scientific principles in toxicology, industrial hygiene, policy, and oncology to prevent, detect, and mitigate environmental public health problems and threats locally and globally; 2) Conduct research for innovative solutions to environmental health issues; and 3) Investigate and monitor environmental hazards and community health status."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	32	MD/MPH     	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Behavioral and Community Health Sciences	25	6	40	yes			University of Pittsburgh Graduate School of Public Health	Spring 2009	Masters	38	MPH/MID	http://www.bchs.pitt.edu			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Pittsburgh.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Pittsburgh.pdf		
Epidemiology (EPI)	11	0	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	39	MPH/MMSC	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_pamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Health (GH)	25	0	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	39	MPH/MMSC	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_pamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Behavioral Sciences & Health Education (BSHE)	18	16	0	Yes		"The Department of Behavioral Sciences and Health Education (BSHE) is committed to improving health behaviors through education, knowledge production, and cutting-edge research in a wide array of public health areas.  BSHE faculty and students employ a variety of disciplinary approaches to implement and evaluate behavioral interventions that address a wide range of public health problems including sexually transmitted diseases, cancer, mental health, smoking, substance abuse, and violence.  BSHE improves health communication by translating research into practice.

BSHE is committed to an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving in domestic and global arenas.  Its faculty has a strong track record of obtaining substantial funding from public and private sources, providing student opportunities in research, and employment with a wide variety of agencies and organizations engaged in public health practice and policy.  Our mission is to prepare students to confront today's public health concerns and to respond to tomorrow's public health challenges."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	39	MPH/MMSC	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_pamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	39	MPH/MMSC	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_pamph.php	Yes	Health Services Management	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Environmental Health (GEH)	10	25	0	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	39	MPH/MMSC	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_pamph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf
