Epidemiology (EPI)	11	0	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	44	MPH/MSN	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_msnmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Health (GH)	25	0	0	Yes		"The Hubert Department of Global Health seeks to understand and reduce global inequities in health and well-being. Inquiry-driven and ethically engaged, we seek to improve health status and delivery systems around the world through teaching, multidisciplinary research, program design and evaluation, service, and inspiring public-private and civic sector engagement in social action. Our Scholarship, our Global Field Experience internships and our Atlanta-based (e.g., CDC, CARE, the Carter Center) and global partnerships provide unparalleled opportunities to increase the capacity of students, fellows, researchers, policy makers and program managers to take on increasing responsibility for global health leadership. Our ultimate goal is to strengthen the capacities of families, communities, societies and governments to identify and reduce barriers to health and wellness."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	44	MPH/MSN	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_msnmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy &  Management (HPM)	27	16	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	44	MPH/MSN	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_msnmph.php	Yes	Health Policy	http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Behavioral Sciences & Health Education (BSHE)	18	20	0	Yes		"The Department of Behavioral Sciences and Health Education (BSHE) is committed to improving health behaviors through education, knowledge production, and cutting-edge research in a wide array of public health areas.  BSHE faculty and students employ a variety of disciplinary approaches to implement and evaluate behavioral interventions that address a wide range of public health problems including sexually transmitted diseases, cancer, mental health, smoking, substance abuse, and violence.  BSHE improves health communication by translating research into practice.

BSHE is committed to an interdisciplinary approach to problem solving in domestic and global arenas.  Its faculty has a strong track record of obtaining substantial funding from public and private sources, providing student opportunities in research, and employment with a wide variety of agencies and organizations engaged in public health practice and policy.  Our mission is to prepare students to confront today's public health concerns and to respond to tomorrow's public health challenges."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	44	MPH/MSN	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_msnmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Global Environmental Health (GEH)	10	25	0	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	44	MPH/MSN	http://www.sph.emory.edu/dualdegree_msnmph.php	Yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Community Health & Social Work	7	47	27	Yes			Saint Louis University School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	45	MPH/MSW		yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/slu.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/SLU.pdf		
International Health & Development	25	0	0	yes		"The combined MPH/MSW degree is offered jointly by the School of Social Work and the School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine, Department of International Health and Development. This program is particularly applicable to students who have had previous experience in international settings or who aspire to work in the international arena, yet also want to obtain credentials in social work. The joint degree increases the student's career options in the future, by providing the individual with two sets of skills that are highly complementary: clinical social work skills, and international public health program skills. Both degrees are internationally recognized and highly regarded.

Typical employment opportunities include international development work in developing countries in nutrition, health education, policy and management, reproductive health, in social or psychosocial programs in HIV/AIDS (orphans and vulnerable children, elderly caring for family members, persons living with HIV/AIDS), and social or psychosocial programs for refugees due to natural disasters or war."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	45	MSW/MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/IHD/index.htm	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Health Education/Communication	18	7	20	yes		"This joint-degree program is designed for those wishing to pursue a career that emphasizes family and child health. This program requires completion of 81 credits: 65 credits in coursework (36 in social work and 30 in public health) and 15 credit hours in field instruction. The program begins in the fall semester and takes five continuous semesters (including the summer). In the beginning of the program students take courses primarily in social work, and as the semesters progress students take an increasing proportion of their courses in the public health. In the last semester students take all of their courses in public health.
Students take school core courses and department core courses in the master of public health curriculum as well as section requirements for the maternal and child health or health education and communication major and electives."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	45	MSW/MPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/CHS/index.htm	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Tropical Medicine	45	36	23	yes		"The MPH&TM program prepares health professionals with clinical backgrounds to deal with the important public health problems of tropical developing countries. By combining a core public health curriculum with coursework on the clinical, epidemiological, and control aspects of tropical diseases, this program prepares physicians to understand tropical medicine from various perspectives, and prepares participants to evaluate and plan disease prevention and control programs.
Graduates are prepared to:
? Work overseas in disease control programs within tropical developing countries at the local, provincial, national or international level. 
? Evaluate epidemiologic, clinical, and laboratory data generated by disease control programs in tropical developing countries, and use those data to develop and test new programs to better serve the needs of those countries. 
? Train paramedical workers to carry out disease programs and evaluate the impact of those workers on disease control. 
? Explain the complex biologic, epidemiologic, environmental, social and behavioral aspects of health and disease in developing countries."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	52	MPHTM	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/tropmed/index.htm			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Tropical Medicine	45	36	23	no		"Tulane's MD/MPH program offers options for students who have already been admitted to Tulane University School of Medicine and who wish to complete the requirements for both the medical degree and public health degree. Requirements for the MD/MPH combined degree should be completed within 4 years.  Students may begin the combined degree program as early as the summer before their School of Medicine curriculum begins. 

The MD/MPHTM program prepares health professionals with clinical backgrounds to deal with the important medical and public health problems of tropical developing countries. The program also provides training for students who wish to be eligible for certification in clinical tropical medicine and traveler?s health (by exam, given by the American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene)."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	53	MD/MPH&TM	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/tropmed/index.htm	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Epidemiology	11	4	0	yes		"The M.S. (Master of Science) degree is an academic degree that offers research training in epidemiology with an emphasis on the understanding of theoretical issues and the application of disciplinary methods to the study of public health problems. The program includes course work in epidemiology and biostatistics, and a research-based master's thesis is required. This degree is also appropriate for physicians or other health professionals who prefer a more focused program than the M.P.H. to prepare for research and teaching careers. The M.S. degree differs from the M.P.H. in that it is intended for students interested primarily in the academic subject matter of the field rather than in professional practice. It is also a natural entry point for those who will eventually continue for their PhD. Thus, students focus on building a strong foundation in a particular specialty field, including its pertinent research methods. No practice placement is required."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	54	MSc	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/epidemiology/index.html			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Biostatistics	3	24	0	yes		"The program emphasizes applied data analysis in the areas of public health and medicine, by preparing students to analyze data in a wide range of settings, including industrial health surveillance and research programs; local, state, and federal governmental agencies; pharmaceutical research divisions; university research programs; and consulting firms. Students learn to assist in selecting a design appropriate for the goals of the research, estimate sample size requirements, establish and maintain data bases, select and conduct the appropriate statistical analysis, and communicate the results of the analysis orally and in writing in the fields of public health. Coursework concentrates on developing these statistical skills through the use of actual data sets and computerized statistical software packages."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	54	MSc	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/biostatistics/index.htm			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Biostatistics	3	0	0	Yes		"Biostatistics is the science that applies statistical theory and methods to the solution of problems in the biological sciences. The biostatistician differs from the traditional statistician in that he or she is confronted by a wider range of problems dealing with all the phenomena that affect people?s physical, social, and mental well-being.

Public Health Informatics is the science underlying the integration of computer science, information science, and public health science applied to the acquisition, management, processing, analysis, and synthesis of public health data, information, and knowledge supporting public health research, education, and practice.

Bioinformatics is defined as the field of science in which biology, computer science, biostatistics and information technology merge to form a single discipline.  Bioinformatics more properly refers to the creation and advancement of algorithms, computational and statistical techniques, and theory to solve formal and practical problems arising from the management and analysis of biological data."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/bios/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Epidemiology	11	0	0	Yes		"Epidemiology is a challenging career choice, especially for individuals with a strong interest in biology and with analytic skills. There is a need for epidemiologists now and in the next millennium who understand the potential of predicting disease occurrence. Our curriculum is grounded in the methodologies of epidemiology and biostatistics that enable graduates to contribute new thinking in the field. We are interested in educating the epidemiologists of the future who will foster this science into its next level.

Emory has some unique features which may be attractive to you. Our close collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which is located adjacent to our campus, in addition to our close collaborations with the State Health Department, Emory Medical School and The American Cancer Society, offers research projects for our students as well as career opportunities. 

Our curriculum is highly quantitative and therefore we recruit students with excellent analytical skills and a strong science background."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/epi/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

The biostatistician differs from the traditional statistician in that he or she is confronted by a wider range of problems dealing with all the phenomena that affect people?s physical, social, and mental well-being.

Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/bios/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Public Nutrition	33	0	0	Yes		"Public Nutrition addresses population-based dietary and nutritional problems by elucidating their extent, determinants, and consequences, and the policies and programs to address them. Nutritional problems exist at national, community, and individual levels and include hunger, childhood malnutrition, famine, suboptimal growth, infection, dietary imbalance or deficiency, and chronic disease. Public Nutrition requires a global perspective, spanning the concerns of wealthy and poor nations. A solid understanding of the biology of nutrition and the socioeconomic and demographic influences on nutrition in conjunction with the principles of design, implementation, and evaluation of interventions is necessary to transform knowledge into the action of public policy and nutrition programs. Students from developed or developing countries can use these skills to serve government ministries, private voluntary organizations, technical agencies, applied research institutions, and universities. The MSPH program in Public Nutrition has a focus in research and advanced rigorous courses in math and science."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/gh/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Health Policy & Health Services Research	16	21	0	Yes		"The Emory Department of Health Policy and Management offer three masters degree programs: the MSPH in Health Policy Research; the MPH in Health Policy; and, the MPH in Health Services Management. The MPH degrees are also offered in a joint degree format with the Law School, the Business School, the Medical School, the School of Nursing, the Physicians Assistant Program and the Physical Therapy Program.

The focus of the MSPH in health policy research is the objective analysis and evaluation of health proposals, programs and services with an emphasis on quantitative analysis using large databases with skills in statistical analysis.

The focus of the MPH in health policy is on the development of a sophisticated understanding of the delivery of health services in the US from both the clinical and population-based perspective.

The focus of the MPH health administration program is on the management of the delivery of health services with a generalist management and leadership perspective including coursework in health law, health economics, healthcare finance, operations management, strategic management, human resources and marketing.

Elective coursework opportunities include aging, health services research, mental health and hygiene, minority health and health disparities, women?s health, health literacy, long-term care, health insurance and health care reform.

Graduates have developed productive careers in academic health centers, public health practice; management consulting, hospital administration, long-term care, advocacy organizations, health plans, state and federal  legislative offices, health policy organizations, and federal programs at CDC, CBO and OIG."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/hpm/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Global Demography	25	38	0	Yes		"The MSPH in Global Demography is designed to train students in demographic field methods, with an emphasis on methods that are suitable for more resource-poor as well as more resource-rich countries and populations. Specifically, students will develop the expertise needed to design and to conduct, or to provide technical assistance to, four major types of demographic field projects. These four types of projects include 1) representative, population-based demographic surveys, 2) in-depth qualitative field studies, 3) on-going demographic surveillance systems (including censuses and vital registration systems), and 4) formal program evaluations and needs assessments. Students also will develop expertise in the analysis of demographic data to inform science and policy."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/gh/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf		
Environmental & Occupational Health/Epidemiology Joint Program (EOH/EPI)	10	34	11	Yes		"The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health focuses on the way the environment affects human health.  Departmental research includes effects of pesticides on neurologic diseases and biomarkers of exposure, air pollution and its link with cardiopulmonary disease and birth defects, water pollution, large-scale epidemiology and occupational exposures relating to heavy metals, solvents, and persistent organic pollutants, urban sprawl, global climate change, and disease ecology. We use a wide variety of methods including epidemiology, toxicology, and risk assessment. Our collaboration partners reach across the globe.

Our department offers an MPH in Environmental and Occupational Health, MPH in Global Environmental Health, and a joint MSPH program in Environmental and Occupational Health/ Epidemiology.  A PhD program in Environmental Health Sciences is planned for 2009."	Emory University Rollins School of Public Health	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.emory.edu/eoh/index.php			http://www.sophas.org/schools/emory.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Emory.pdf

Industrial Hygiene	34	10	0	yes		"The program in Industrial Hygiene is designed for mid-career professionals and leads to the Master of Science in Public Health degree.
The overall goal of the industrial hygiene program is the education and practical training of degreed scientists and engineers as professional industrial hygienists. Graduates are prepared to enter careers in industry, government, academia, and other areas where the skills and competencies of an industrial hygienist are required. The program is designed to provide the academic preparation needed to pass the certification examination administered by the American Board of Industrial Hygiene. As such, graduates are provided with classroom preparation in the anticipation, recognition, evaluation and control of chemical, biological, and physical health stressors in the workplace and indoor environments."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Distance Learning	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Summer 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/		Distance Learning	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Biostatistics	3	24	0	yes		"The program emphasizes applied data analysis in the areas of public health and medicine, by preparing students to analyze data in a wide range of settings, including industrial health surveillance and research programs; local, state, and federal governmental agencies; pharmaceutical research divisions; university research programs; and consulting firms. Students learn to assist in selecting a design appropriate for the goals of the research, estimate sample size requirements, establish and maintain data bases, select and conduct the appropriate statistical analysis, and communicate the results of the analysis orally and in writing in the fields of public health. Coursework concentrates on developing these statistical skills through the use of actual data sets and computerized statistical software packages."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/biostatistics/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Tropical Medicine (Parasitology)	45	36	23	yes		"The Department of Tropical Medicine has a long and proud history of contributions to the fields of parasitology and tropical medicine. The department is one of the oldest of its kind in the world, and has established a strong international reputation for research in vector-borne and other tropical infectious diseases. The Department of Tropical Medicine offers a Master in Science in Public Health, with a focus in parasitology to students with an undergraduate degree and with a solid background in biological sciences. Graduates of the program are prepared to work in disease control programs or parasitology diagnostic laboratories. Many graduates enter medical school or doctor of philosophy programs.  "	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	62	MSPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/tropmed/index.htm		Master's International Program with the US Peace Corps	http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Environmental Health	10	19	0	yes		"The JD/MSPH program is an expansion of the mid-career program in which 42 credits are required in the school of public health and 79 credits in the law school over a four-year period. Mutual acceptance of elective courses provides a time savings to the student of approximately one year.

Law school course credit may be applied toward the environmental health sciences degree. This credit is in addition to the 28 hours taken in the school of public health. Twelve credits of relevant course work may be applied specifically: ocean and coastal law; resources, energy and environmental law; energy law; water law; and land-Use planning. The research (or practicum) will be done at a site approved by both schools.

The general learning objective of these programs is to promote appreciation of the technical complexities and legal ramifications of the technical complexities and legal ramifications involving environmental policy, planning, and regulations. The graduate is able to integrate scientific and legal principles involved in the recognition, evaluation and control of environmental."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	63	JD/MSPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/EHS/	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Biostatistics	3	24	0	no		"Tulane's MD/MPH program offers options for students who have already been admitted to Tulane University School of Medicine and who wish to complete the requirements for both the medical degree and public health degree. Requirements for the MD/MPH combined degree should be completed within 4 years.  Students may begin the combined degree program as early as the summer before their School of Medicine curriculum begins. The MD/MSPH program focusing in Biostatistics offers students a broad range of data analysis skills, including principles of statistical inference, methods of data description and analysis, and database management. This degree prepares candidates for research in medical sciences and better understanding of the literature. "	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Masters	64	MD/MSPH	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/biostatistics/index.htm	yes		http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf

Epidemiology	11	23	4	yes		"The Ph.D. is the terminal degree in epidemiology.  The purpose of the PhD program is to prepare students for a career in epidemiologic research and teaching, usually in an academic setting. In addition, there are an increasing number of non-university research organizations that need highly skilled independent researchers. The Ph.D. program has a strong theoretical base, is focused on research, and graduates are expected to have knowledge across a wide range of epidemiologic theory and methods."	Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine	Fall 2009	Doctoral	68	PhD	http://www.sph.tulane.edu/epidemiology/index.html			http://www.sophas.org/schools/Tulane.cfm	http://www.sophas.org/documents/Tulane.pdf		
Tropical Medicine	45	36	23	yes		"The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) program in tropical medicine and parasitology prepares individuals who seek in-depth training in tropical infectious disease research for careers in academic, health, or industry research settings.  A major goal is to place students in well-funded research laboratories where they receive excellent training and mentoring.  Recent student research articles in peer reviewed scientific journals span a spectrum of pathogens from West Nile and Ebola viruses to malaria, Chagas disease, Lyme spirochetes, and schistosomes.  The degree requires 60 credit hours of course and research work." Biostatistics	3	24	0	yes		"This program emphasizes applied statistics in the fields of public health and medicine; it is designed to equip the student to design, carry out, and conduct the statistical analyses for research studies in these areas. Students are required to select an area of specialization within public health (e.g., chronic disease epidemiology, infectious disease epidemiology, environmental health, behavioral aspects of health)." Health Systems Management	16	17	27	yes		"The Executive ScD program is offered in a non-residential format for practicing health care executives and leaders in public health. The program, also referred to as the EDOC program, is based on health management, policy and health services research principles in order toimprove the health of populations through the application of advanced analytical and research knowledge and skills. It is a professional doctorate degree program designed to expand the horizons of professionals in the changing world of health systems. Students are admitted into the program every other year."
